content: I don't have a personal preference or opinion. however, if you're an experienced hiker and want a trail with incredible views and challenging terrain, the hangover trail is definitely worth the extra effort. it's a more difficult trail, but the views of cathedral rock and the surrounding red rock formations are breathtaking. the trail also offers more of a sense of seclusion, as it's less popular than some of the other trails in sedona. on the other hand, if you're looking for a remote and challenging trail, the secret canyon trail might be a better choice. it's a more off-the-beaten-path trail with a unique and remote canyon environment that's full of flora and fauna. the trail is more isolated, so you're more likely to have a sense of solitude. however, it's recommended for experienced hikers due to the challenging terrain and steep climbs. the trail is less crowded than some of the other sedona trails, which gives you the opportunity to enjoy the serenity of nature.
